issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: Titanium SDK & CLI
components.description: Please enter tickets related to the MobileSDK here.

fields.description:
When specifying the "type" attribute of Picker to 
Ti.UI.PICKER_TYPE_DATE
The error shown is <id> name of the Picker is not defined.
For eg if my Alloy app says
index.xml
===========
<Picker id ="datepicker"></Picker>

index.tss
===========
"#datepicker":{
  type: Ti.UI.PICKER_TYPE_DATE
}

The error shown is 
Reference variable not defined "datepicker"

I fixed the issue by correcting the type mentioned to "Titanium.UI.PICKER_TYPE_DATE"

If only the error message would have been appropriate, it would have been much easier for me to fix it.
fields.summary: Error Notification for DateType picker not appropriate.
fields.environment: Mac Maverics, Titanium SDK 3.3.0 Android 4.4.2, Alloy
